Myanmar’s re-emergence on the international stage will continue next week when the European Union’s foreign policy chief, Catherine Ashton, will lead a ‘task-force’ of European commissioners, members of the European Parliament, businessmen and members of civil-society groups on a three-day visit (13-15 November) to the country.
The European Union may give Myanmar – Burma – up to €90 million a year in its 2014-20 development-aid budget.
